intro: Astroloma latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Astroloma latifolium is often found in open woodlands and shrublands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
